alert.note: Alert for McDonald (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 24 at 11:32AM CDT until March 26 at 2:02PM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 330 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Missouri, including the following counties, Barry and McDonald. * WHEN...Until 330 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Numerous roads remain closed due to flooding. Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. Low-water crossings are inundated with water and may not be passable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1129 AM CDT, The Department of Transportation reported numerous flooded roadways from previous heavy rainfall in the warned area. Between 3 and 5 inches of rain have fallen. Up to an additional 0.5 to 1 inches of additional moderate rain are expected through mid to late this afternoon. - This includes the following low water crossings... Bentonville Hollow at Highway E, Rockhouse Creek at Farm Road 2145, Flat Creek at Highway C, Flat Creek at Highway U, Little Sugar Creek at Skaggs Hollow Road, Big Sugar Creek at Buzzard Glory Road and Mikes Creek at Highway U. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles.
